title: Tooth color and health: What different shades reveal about your well-being
description: Your teeth's colour changes can signal serious health issues beyond just staining. Yellowing might indicate liver problems or diabetes, while gray or dark teeth could point to trauma, heavy metal exposure, or kidney disease. White spots may signal enamel hypoplasia due to nutritional deficiencies. Pay attention to these signs for early health detection.

What is China's illegal ‘996’ work culture that Narayana Murthy has pitched for India
description: Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy's suggestion of a 72-hour workweek, referencing China's "996" culture, has reignited debate. While China's "996" model powered its tech boom, it led to burnout and was eventually declared illegal due to its detrimental impact on workers' well-being.

description: An Indian national, Jagjit Singh, visiting Canada on a temporary visa, has been convicted of criminally harassing two teenage girls near their school. Singh's actions, including attempting to take photos and putting his arm around a student, led to his arrest and a jail sentence following which he has been ordered to be deported and never to return to Canada.

The process aims for clean rolls but faces opposition concerns.

Kidney health: Daily water intake, dehydration & overhydration risks explained
description: Kidneys balance the fluids and the salts in the bod, and keeps the urine clear. Clear urine means a lower chance of kidney stones and urinary infections. When you do not drink enough water, the kidneys have to work harder to make the urine more concentrated. That extra work can strain the kidneys over time

Explained: How new labour laws may cut take-home salary; raise PF & gratuity contributions
description: New labour codes effective November 21, 2025, mandate basic salary at 50% of CTC, potentially lowering take-home pay as retirement contributions rise. These unified laws aim to simplify compliance and boost worker safeguards. Expect higher provident fund and gratuity payments, impacting immediate earnings while enhancing long-term retirement security for employees.

title: Identifying the early signs of mouth cancer: Causes, diagnosis & more
description: Mouth cancer, a serious global health issue, often goes undetected until advanced stages. Key risk factors include tobacco, alcohol, and HPV. Early signs like persistent sores, unusual patches, or lumps demand immediate medical attention. Prompt diagnosis through examinations and biopsies, followed by treatments like surgery and radiation, significantly improves survival rates. Prevention through lifestyle changes and regular check-ups is paramount.

Nvidia chip smuggling case: US arrests tech firm CTO
description: Four individuals, including two American citizens and two PRC nationals residing in the U.S., have been charged with illegally exporting advanced Nvidia GPUs to China. The conspiracy involved falsifying paperwork and using a shell company to circumvent U.S. export controls, with over $3.89 million in wire transfers received from China to fund the scheme.

title: $1 trillion squad: Musk, Zuckerberg, Pichai, and fellow billionaires break the internet
description: An AI-generated image of tech titans like Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg in a parking lot has gone viral, sparking memes and commentary. The "$1 trillion squad" photo perfectly captures the 2025 mood of AI races and billionaire influence, becoming a cultural phenomenon.

title: Brittany Mahomes stuns in red leather on date with Patrick before Chiefs–Colts game
description: Patrick Mahomes and the Chiefs face a crucial home game against the Colts, needing a win to boost playoff hopes after two road losses. Off the field, Mahomes shared a personal moment with his wife, Brittany, enjoying a night out at their steakhouse, 1587 Prime, highlighting their connection amidst the NFL season's pressures.

title: Stefon Diggs' lady love Cardi B raves about hospital stay after giving birth
description: Rapper Cardi B shared her positive hospital experience after giving birth. She praised the food and treatment, joking about getting pregnant again soon. Fans reacted to her comments online. Cardi B is preparing for her upcoming tour in February 2026. Her album 'Am I The Drama' was released on September 19.

title: Ciara on Russell Wilson: Maturity and 'fullness as a man' define their marriage
description: Singer Ciara revealed on the 'Angie Martinez IRL' podcast that her husband, Russell Wilson, despite being younger, acts as an emotional anchor due to his 'old soul' and maturity. She finds his grounded demeanor provides stability amidst NFL pressures and fame.  Ciara emphasized his 'fullness as a man' enriches their strong partnership.

title: Cardiologist reveals the 1 morning habit triggering heart attacks
description: Cortisol, as we know is the stress hormone, that can raise blood pressure and heart during mental or emotional stress. The cortisol surge lowers heart rate variability. Dr. Heigl, showed data from continuous ECG monitors: in patients with cardiac events, heart rate variability dropped sharply within minutes of waking

title: Check right time to eat yoghurt for gut health, probiotics & more
description: Unlock yoghurt's full potential by timing your intake strategically. For optimal gut health and probiotic benefits, consume it before or with meals. To aid weight loss, enjoy it as a hunger-curbing snack or before meals. Post-exercise consumption can boost bone strength. Opt for plain, unsweetened varieties for maximum nutritional impact.

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman to employees in internal memo: Google’s AI success can create…
description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman acknowledges Google's AI advancements, noting potential "temporary economic headwinds" but expressing confidence in OpenAI's rapid progress and leadership in the AI race. Despite concerns about slowing ChatGPT engagement, Altman urged employees to focus on achieving superintelligence, highlighting the company's strength and unique challenges.
